section.title: Manage page navigation
section.para: Navigation types in eXo Platform are outlined in the Manage navigation nodes.

section.title: Portal's page navigation
section.para: The /platform/administrators group can do actions related to the page navigation of a portal, including adding/deleting portals, editing the layout/navigation/portal configuration.

note.para: The page navigation of portal is created automatically when a portal is created.
The navigation will be deleted automatically after its portal has been deleted.

section.title: User's page navigation
section.para: Actions related to the page navigation of users include adding a new page, editing a page/page layout. These actions are based on permission settings set to a page.

note.para: The page navigation of a user will be created automatically when the user is created (registered).
Only the user who is the owner of the user page navigation can edit it.
No one can create a user page navigation so that no one can delete it. The navigation will be deleted automatically when its user is deleted.

section.title: Group's page navigation
section.para: Each group has only one page navigation. Only managers of the navigation group and users of the administrators group can add/list/edit/delete the navigation or edit properties.

To manage the group's page navigation, hover your cursor over
on the Administration bar, then select Portal Group Sites
from the drop-down menu.
The Group Navigation Management page will appear.
Here, you can do many actions, including:

section.title: Edit a group's page navigation
section.para: Click Edit Navigation corresponding to the group navigation you want to edit. The Navigation Management form will appear.

In this form, you can edit the group's page navigation through doing many actions, such as adding a new node to this group, cloning, moving up/down, and more. To learn more about specific actions, refer to the Manage navigation nodes section.

section.title: Create a new page navigation

note.para: Only users who are "managers" of a group can create new pages for that group, while others in this group cannot.

step.para: Select Add Navigation at the bottom of the Group Navigation form. The groups list will be displayed with the Add Navigation buttons.
Click Add Navigation corresponding to the group you want to add the new page navigation.
After being added, the new group navigation will be displayed in the Group Navigation page.

section.para: Each group has only one navigation. If you add a new group navigation that has been existing, there will be a message, informing that you cannot create the navigation.

section.title: Change priority of page's navigation
section.para: This function is to change the priority of a navigation. Only users who have the right can take this action.

step.para: Click Edit Properties corresponding to the navigation you want to edit.
The Page Navigation Form will appear.
Select another priority from the list of available priorities.

section.title: Delete a group's navigation
section.para: This function is used to delete the existing navigation. It is only supported for the group navigation. A user navigation or a portal navigation will be automatically deleted when the user or portal is deleted respectively.

step.para: Click Delete Navigation corresponding to the navigation you want to delete.
Click OK in the confirmation message to accept your deletion.

section.para: After the navigation deletion has been confirmed, the selected navigation will be removed from the Group Navigation page and its nodes/hyperlinks to pages will also be deleted.
